dublinCore.dc:title: 114 S1547 IS: Partner with Korea Act
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Mr. Isakson (for himself, Mr. Warner, and Mr. Schatz) introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on the Judiciary

form.official-title: To provide high-skilled visas for nationals of the Republic of Korea, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Partner with Korea Act.

section.header: Reciprocal visas for nationals of South Korea

subsection.text: Section 101(a)(15)(E) of the Immigration and Nationality Act (8 U.S.C. 1101(a)(15)(E)) is amended—

paragraph.text: by striking join him: (i) solely to carry and inserting the following: “join him—
by striking (ii) solely to develop and inserting the following:
by striking or (iii) solely to perform and inserting the following:
by adding at the end the following: “or

clause.text: solely to perform services in a specialty occupation in the United States if the alien is a national of the Republic of Korea and with respect to whom the Secretary of Labor determines and certifies to the Secretary of Homeland Security and the Secretary of State that the intending employer has filed an attestation with the Secretary of Labor under section 212(t)(1);

subsection.text: Section 212 of such Act (8 U.S.C. 1182), is amended—

paragraph.text: in subsection (t), as added by section 402(b)(2) of the United States-Chile Free Trade Agreement Implementation Act (Public Law 108–77; 117 Stat. 941)—

subparagraph.text: by striking section 101(a)(15)(H)(i)(b1) or section 101(a)(15)(E)(iii) each place it appears and inserting subparagraph (E)(iii), (E)(iv), or (H)(i)(b1) of section 101(a)(15); and

in clauses (i)(II), (ii)(II), and (iii)(II) of paragraph (3)(C), by striking section 204, 214(c), 101(a)(15)(H)(i)(b1), or 101(a)(15)(E)(iii) or section 101(a)(15)(E)(iii) each place it appears and inserting subparagraph (E)(iii), (E)(iv), or (H)(1)(b1) of section 101(a)(15) or section 204 or 214(c); and

paragraph.text: by redesignating subsection (t), as added by section 1(b)(2)(B) of Public Law 108–449 (118 Stat. 3470), as subsection (u).

subsection.text: Section 214(g) of such Act (8 U.S.C. 1184(g)) is amended by adding at the end the following:

subparagraph.text: The Secretary of State may not approve more than 15,000 initial applications submitted for aliens described in section 101(a)(15)(E)(iv) in any fiscal year.
The numerical limitation under subparagraph (A) shall only apply to principal aliens and shall not apply to the spouses or children of such aliens.

subsection.text: Section 214(i)(1) of such Act (8 U.S.C. 1184(i)(1)) is amended by striking section 101(a)(15)(H)(i)(b), section 101(a)(15)(E)(iii), and paragraph (2), and inserting paragraph (2) of this subsection and subparagraphs (E)(iii), (E)(iv), and (H)(i)(b) of section 101(a)(15),.
